entries.title: The Internet Hijacked Our Sense of Time
entries.description: Want to break bad screen habits? Start by guessing how long you spend on games, social media and TikTok.

entries.title: Startups Want to Help Airlines Prevent Tech Meltdowns
entries.description: Recent FAA and Southwest snafus are advancing arguments for modernizing the industry with cloud-based systems that allow crucial operations data to flow more freely.

entries.title: Chips Are the New Oil and America Is Spending Billions to Safeguard Its Supply
entries.description: Recent shortages and fears of China’s ambitions to dominate the industry have led to a frenetic effort to rev up U.S. production. But securing the supply of semiconductors will be complicated.

entries.title: This Fish-Gutting Machine Contains the Secret of a Future, Less-Globalized Economy
entries.description: Once suitable only for making prototypes, 3-D printing is now reliable enough for mass-produced commercial products, upending the way manufacturing works.

entries.title: Twitter Offers Free Ads as It Seeks to Woo Brands Back to Its Platform
entries.description: The tech company is dangling free ad space by offering to match advertisers’ ad spending up to $250,000.
